required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Follow-Up Studies at Year 6, 7, 8, 9, 10: 2 Formulations of Combined Hepatitis A/B Vaccine Compared in Subjects Aged 12-15 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluate Persistence of Immune Response of GSK Biologicals' TWINRIX™ Vaccine Administered According to 0,6 Month Schedule Versus TWINRIX™ JUNIOR Administered According to 0,1,6 Month Schedule, in Subjects Aged 12-15 Years at Time of First Vaccine Dose

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the persistence of anti-hepatitis A virus (anti-HAV) and anti-hepatitis B surface antigen (anti-HBs) antibodies up to 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 years after administration of the first dose of the study vaccine.

detailed_description.textblock:
Open, randomized, long-term antibody persistence studies. Immune persistence was compared between subjects who received one of the two formulations of GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals' combined hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine according to a two-dose or three-dose schedule. These long-term follow-up studies involved taking blood samples at approximately 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 years after the primary vaccination of combined hepatitis A and B vaccine, to assess antibody persistence and a retrospective safety follow-up.
The Protocol Posting has been updated in order to comply with the FDA Amendment Act, Sep 2007.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 after the first vaccine dose of a two-dose or three-dose primary vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Anti-HAV antibody concentration cut-off value assessed was ≥ 15 milli-International Units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HBs) Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-Off Value
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 after the first vaccine dose of a two-dose or three-dose primary vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Anti-HBs antibody concentration cut-off value assessed was ≥ 3.3 mIU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Serious Adverse Events (SAE) Causally Related to Primary Vaccination or Related to Hepatitis A or B Infection or Related to Study Participation (Blood Sampling)
primary_outcome.description: An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that: results in death, is life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/ incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject, or may evolve into one of the outcomes listed above.

arm_group.description: Subjects received Twinrix™ Adult (720/20) in a 0, 6 month schedule in the primary study.
Subjects received Twinrix™ Junior (360/10) in a 0, 1, 6 month schedule in the primary study.

intervention.description: Intramuscular administration in the deltoid region (2 doses).
Intramuscular administration in the deltoid region (3 doses).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female volunteers vaccinated in study HAB-084.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject before the blood sampling visit of each year.
Exclusion Criteria:
• none

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

reference.citation: Beran J, Kervyn D, Wertzova V, Hobzova L, Tichy P, Kuriyakose S, Leyssen M, Jacquet JM. Comparison of long-term (10 years) immunogenicity of two- and three-dose regimens of a combined hepatitis A and B vaccine in adolescents. Vaccine. 2010 Aug 23;28(37):5993-7. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2010.06.104. Epub 2010 Jul 15.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: At the time of initiation of the long-term follow-up study, the investigators contacted the subjects who had consented to participate in the long-term follow-up studies. At each subsequent visit, subjects who were present at the previous long-term blood sampling time points were contacted again.

group.title: Group Twinrix Junior
group.description: Subjects received Twinrix™ Junior (360/10) in a 0, 1, 6 month schedule in the primary study.

group.title: Group Twinrix Adult
group.description: Subjects received Twinrix™ Adult (720/20) in a 0, 6 month schedule in the primary study.

participants_list.participants: 4 subjects who participated in the Year 6 follow-up time point did not return for this time point.
4 subjects who participated in the Year 6 follow-up time point did not return for this time point.
One additional subject (compared to Year 7) participated in the current follow-up time point.
One subject participating in the Year 8 time point did not return for the current time point.
One subject participating in the Year 8 time point did not return for the current time point.
One subject participating in the Year 9 time point did not return for the current time point.
Six subjects participating in the Year 9 time point did not return for the current time point.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Subjects' mean age at Year 6, the time of first enrollment into the long-term follow-up phase of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-hepatitis A Virus (HAV) Antibody Concentrations Above the Cut-off Value
outcome.description: Anti-HAV antibody concentration cut-off value assessed was ≥ 15 milli-International Units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: Year 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 after the first vaccine dose of a two-dose or three-dose primary vaccination
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Long Term According To Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all subjects for whom serology results were available for a particular blood sampling visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
